actions.in_committee: House Committee on Public Works + Transportation
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Mr. Panetta asked unanimous consent that the Committee on Public Works + Transportation have until 5:00 p.m. on March 13 to file a report on H.R. 1231. Objection was heard.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. H. Rept. 101-3.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 5.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 108 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1231 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 (l)(6) of rule XI. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended be the Committee on Public Works and Transportation shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five minute rule. Consideration of amendments made in order shall be limited to three hours. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. No amendments are in order except amendments adding new sections.
Rule H. Res. 108 passed House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 108.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1231 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Waiving all points of order against consideration of the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2 (l)(6) of rule XI. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Public Works and Transportation shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment under the five minute rule. Consideration of amendments made in order shall be limited to three hours. Measure will be read by section. Specified amendments are in order. No amendments are in order except amendments adding new sections.
House resolved itself into the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union pursuant to H. Res. 108 and Rule XXIII.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Byron L. Dorgan to act as Chairman of the Committee.
GENERAL DEBATE - The Committee of the Whole proceeded with one hour of general debate.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 1231.
The House adopted the amendment in the nature of a substitute as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 252 - 167 (Roll No. 8).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate. Read twice. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 33.
Motion to proceed to consideration of measure made in Senate.
Cloture motion on the motion to proceed presented in Senate.
Motion to proceed considered in Senate.
Motion to proceed to consideration of measure withdrawn in Senate.
Senate vitiated the cloture vote on the motion to proceed by Unanimous Consent.
Motion to proceed to consideration of measure made in Senate.
Cloture motion on the motion to proceed presented in Senate.
Motion to proceed to consideration of measure withdrawn in Senate.
Cloture on the motion to proceed to the consideration of H.R.1231 invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 61-36. Record Vote No: 222.
Motion to proceed to consideration of measure agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.
Considered by Senate.
Amendment SP 1043 proposed by Senator Mitchell.
Considered by Senate.
Cloture motion on amendment SP 1043 presented in Senate.
Considered by Senate.
Cloture on amendment SP 1043 invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 62-38. Record Vote No: 273.
Amendment SP 1043 agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 65-35. Record Vote No: 276.
Passed Senate with an amendment and an amendment to the Title by Voice Vote.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Anderson asked unanimous consent that the House agree to the Senate amendments.
On motion that the House agree to the Senate amendments Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Vetoed by President.
The Chair laid before the House the veto message from the President.
Mr. Anderson moved to refer the bill and accompanying veto message to the Committee on Public Works + Transportation.
On motion to refer the bill and the accompanying veto message to the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. Agreed to without objection.
Mr. Anderson moved that the House discharge the Committee on Public Works and Transportation from further consideration of the President's veto message.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to discharge.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On motion to discharge the Committee on Public Works and Transportation from further consideration of the President's veto message Agreed to by voice vote.
UNFINISHED BUSINESS - The Chair announced the unfinished business to be the further consideration of the veto message from the President on the bill H.R. 1231.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to pass the bill upon reconsideration, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On passage, the objections of the President to the contrary notwithstanding Failed by the Yeas and Nays (2/3 required): 261 - 160 (Roll No. 22).
Mr. Anderson moved to refer the bill and accompanying veto message to the Committee on Public Works + Transportation.
On motion to refer the bill and the accompanying veto message to the Committee on Public Works + Transportation. Agreed to without objection.

official_title: An Act to establish a commission to investigate and report respecting the dispute between Eastern Airlines and its collective bargaining units, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Establishes a Commission to investigate, and report to the Congress and the Secretary of Transportation on, the labor dispute involving Eastern Airlines and the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers, the Air Line Pilots Association, and the Transport Workers Union. Requires that Commission members be appointed within ten days after enactment of this Act by specified congressional officers. Requires the Commission to submit such report to the Congress and the Secretary within 45 days after enactment of this Act. Directs the Secretary to make the report available to the public. Provides that this Act shall be carried out using funds otherwise available to the Secretary for expenses of advisory committees. Terminates the Commission upon submission of its report.

titles.title: To direct the President to establish an emergency board to investigate and report respecting the dispute between Eastern Airlines and its collective bargaining units.
An Act to establish a commission to investigate and report respecting the dispute between Eastern Airlines and its collective bargaining units, and for other purposes.
